title: How Can Lord Krishna or Rama Become Visible to Us? | HH Stoka Krishna Swami
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: He comes in his original transcendental form means the form in the spiritual world which is eternal and completely spiritual but we cannot see him in that form but then they become visible as Krishna as Rama as Narasimha as Varaha by giving us the power to see them
segments.summary: Lord Krishna appears in his transcendental form, which is beyond our material perception, but he grants us the ability to see him in various forms like Krishna, Rama, Narasimha, and Varaha.
segments.transcript: Now, when Krishna Rama appears as the son of his devotees, apparently taking birth like an ordinary human being, it's not at all ordinary. It is not at all material. He doesn't accept a material form. He comes in his original transcendental form, meaning the form in the spiritual world, which is eternal and completely spiritual. But we cannot see him in that form. But then they become visible as Krishna, as Rama, as Narasimha, as Varaha, by giving us the power to see them, because our eyes can only perceive material forms, and that too, not all material forms. Like, if the devatas were to come, and do come to this Earth planet sometimes, we cannot see them with these eyes, because these eyes can't see them. These eyes can only perceive gross form.
